column4: ALABAMA FUEL & IRON COMPANY History: Incorporated under laws of Alabama; April 15; 1908; successor to the Alabama Fuel & Steel Co.; Prop- erty consists of coal and iron lands in Jefferson; St. Clair; Shelby; Tuscaloosa; Bibb; DeKalb and Franklin Counties; Ala. Mines located at Acton; on the line of the L. & N. R.R.; Margaret and Acmar; on the Central of Georgia; brown ore mine located at Russellville; Ala.; on Northern Ala. Ry. In June; 1910; purchased the property and holdings of the Russell- ville Iron Ore & Metal Co.; of Russellville; Ala. Management: OFFICERS: J. M. Overton; Pres.; Nashville; Tenn.; H. T. De Bardeleben; Vice-Pres.; C. F. De Bar- deleben; Vice-Pres. and Gen. Mgr.; W. W. Fulghum; See. and Treas.; Birmingham; Ala.; C. Cooper; Asst. Sec.; Nashville; Tenn. DIRECTORS: J. M. Overton; Wm. REFERENCE NOTE ON STOCK ISSUE: Authorized; $3;500;000; outstanding; $3;496;300; par $100. Registrar: Nashville Trust Co. Stock transferred at com- panys office; Nashville; Tenn. Dividends of 1% each were paid in December; 1908; June 20 and Dec. 20; 1909; and quarterly from April 1; 1910; to April; 1917; June and Oct.; 1917; 11/2% each; Jan.; 1918; 2 %; April; 1918; to Jan.; 1920; 11/2% quarterly; 2% extra each paid Jan.; 1919; and Jan.; 1920.

THE ALLIANCE REALTY COMPANY History: Incorporated June 6; 1899; in New York; to deal in New York City real estate and improve the same. Holds a controlling interest in the Broad Exchange Company (which see); which company erected and owns a large office build- ing on the southeast corner of Broad Street and Exchange Place; New York. Management: OFFICERS: Walter T. Rosen; Pres.; H. S. Black; Vice-Pres.; C. G. Dailey; Vice-Pres.; Howard W. Smith; Sec. and Treas. DIRECTORS: R. G. Babbage; Alwyn Ball; Jr.; H. S. Black; E. M. No bonds. The United States Realty Improvement Company owns $403;300 of the stock. Stock transferred at companys office. Registrar: Guaranty Trust Co.; New York. Dividends have been paid as follows: 1902 to 1905; inclusive; 6% per annum; 1906; 7% %; 1907; 1908 and 1909; 8% each; 1910; 8% and 6% extra; 1911; 1912; 1913 and 1914; 8% each. In Jan.; 1915; quarterly dividend re- duced to 11/2%; making 6% per annum; which rate is now being paid. Payments quarterly; January 15; at companys office. See rating below. Provisional Ratings: As this company does not furnish an income account or other statistics which are essential for the rating of its securities in our standardized form; we insert ratings of a provisional character which are based on the known facts and on such special data as we have been able to obtain. For full explanation; see Key to Ratings; pages 11 to 18. 1. Alliance Realty Co.; capital stock (par $100) Rating; p. A.
